news_header: A plane crash in South Sudan killed at least 19 people, including the pilot and co-pilot, shortly after departure from Unity Oil Field.
news_text: A plane bound for Juba crashed shortly after taking off from South Sudan's Unity Oil Field, resulting in at least 19 fatalities, including the pilot and co-pilot. The aircraft, chartered by the Greater Pioneer Operating Company and operated by Light Air Services Aviation Company, had 21 people on board, with only one survivor. The Unity State information minister confirmed the incident and stated that an investigation would be conducted, as the region has a history of air crashes.
